docs.snippet: American foreign traders were enthusiastic here last week over accomplishments of the River Plate countries at their first regional conference at Montevideo. Uruguay, As viewed by exporters here, the conference was the first step in a movement which...
docs.lead_paragraph: American foreign traders were enthusiastic here last week over accomplishments of the River Plate countries at their first regional conference at Montevideo. Uruguay, As viewed by exporters here, the conference was the first step in a movement which is bound to spur the interchange of goods among the Latin-American nations and put their economies in a more balanced state.

headline.main: TRADERS HERE HAIL RIVER PLATE PACTS; Interchange of Basic Materials Will Improve State of Latin Trade, They Feel SEE OUR ECONOMY AIDED Specialized Finished Items Are Forecast as Backbone of Future U.S. Exports

docs.snippet: A gala Fiesta Pan-Americana was presented last night in the grand ballroom of the Waldorf-Astoria as the annual benefit ball for the Goddard Neighborhood Center, a settlement at 599 First Avenue which conducts a widespread social service program...
docs.lead_paragraph: A gala Fiesta Pan-Americana was presented last night in the grand ballroom of the Waldorf-Astoria as the annual benefit ball for the Goddard Neighborhood Center, a settlement at 599 First Avenue which conducts a widespread social service program among underprivileged families of the middle East Side.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) -- The Senate unanimously confirmed today the nomination of John G. Winant to be Ambassador to Great Britain.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) -- The Senate unanimously confirmed today the nomination of John G. Winant to be Ambassador to Great Britain.

headline.main: UNANIMOUS VOTE CONFIRMS WINANT; Senate Acts on Nomination of New Ambassador to the Court of St. James's HE GOES TO THE CAPITAL Expects to Confer Today With Hull on Duties in London -- Other Diplomatic Changes

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 -- United States imports of cattle and beef in 1940 were 20 per cent less than in 1939, the Department of Agriculture announced today. Beef cattle imports were down 16 per cent. Canned beef imports declined 29 per cent.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 -- The current attempt at the quick organization of an all-Western Hemisphere front has brought the United States face to face with a variety of political, economic and psychological problems, some expected and some unexpected.
